verses.verse: Then <WG1899> fourteen <WG1180> years <WG2094> after <WG1223> I went <WG305> up again <WG3825> to Jerusalem <WG2414> with Barnabas, <WG921> and took <WG4838> Titus <WG5103> with me also. <WG2532>

And I went <WG305> up by revelation, <WG602> and communicated <WG394> to them that gospel <WG2098> which <WG3739> I preach <WG2784> among <WG1722> the Gentiles, <WG1484> but privately <WG2596> <WG2398> to them which were of reputation, <WG1380> lest <WG3381> by any <WG3381> means <WG4458> I should run, <WG5143> or <WG2228> had run, <WG5143> in vain. <WG2756>
But neither <WG3761> Titus, <WG5103> who <WG3588> was with me, being <WG5607> a Greek, <WG1672> was compelled <WG315> to be circumcised: <WG4059>

And that because <WG1223> of false <WG5569> brothers <WG5569> unawares <WG3920> brought <WG3920> in, who <WG3748> came <WG3922> in privately <WG3922> to spy <WG2684> out our liberty <WG1657> which <WG3739> we have <WG2192> in Christ <WG5547> Jesus, <WG2424> that they might bring <WG2615> us into bondage: <WG2615>
To whom <WG3739> we gave <WG1502> place <WG1502> by subjection, <WG5292> no, not for an hour; <WG5610> that the truth <WG225> of the gospel <WG2098> might continue <WG1265> with you.

But of these who seemed <WG1380> to be somewhat, <WG5100> (whatever <WG3697> <WG4219> they were, it makes <WG1308> no <WG3762> matter <WG1308> to me: God <WG2316> accepts <WG2983> no <WG3756> man's <WG444> person: <WG4383>) for they who seemed <WG1380> to be somewhat in conference <WG4323> added <WG4323> nothing <WG3762> to me:

But contrariwise, <WG5121> when they saw <WG1492> that the gospel <WG2098> of the uncircumcision <WG203> was committed <WG4100> to me, as the gospel of the circumcision <WG4061> was to Peter; <WG4074>

(For he that worked <WG1754> effectually <WG1754> in Peter <WG4074> to the apostleship <WG651> of the circumcision, <WG4061> the same <WG2532> was mighty <WG1754> in me toward <WG1519> the Gentiles: <WG1484>)

And when James, <WG2385> Cephas, <WG2786> and John, <WG2491> who <WG3588> seemed <WG1380> to be pillars, <WG4769> perceived <WG1097> the grace <WG5485> that was given <WG1325> to me, they gave <WG1325> to me and Barnabas <WG921> the right <WG1188> hands <WG1188> of fellowship; <WG2842> that we should go to the heathen, <WG1484> and they to the circumcision. <WG4061>
Only <WG3440> they would that we should remember <WG3421> the poor; <WG4434> the same <WG846> <WG5124> which <WG3739> I also <WG2532> was forward <WG4704> to do. <WG4160>
But when <WG3753> Peter <WG4074> was come <WG2064> to Antioch, <WG490> I withstood <WG436> him to the face, <WG4383> because <WG3754> he was to be blamed. <WG2607>

For before <WG4253> that certain <WG5100> came <WG2064> from James, <WG2385> he did eat <WG4906> with the Gentiles: <WG1484> but when <WG3753> they were come, <WG2064> he withdrew <WG5288> and separated <WG873> himself, <WG1438> fearing <WG5399> them which were of the circumcision. <WG4061>

And the other <WG3062> Jews <WG2453> dissembled <WG4942> likewise <WG2532> with him; so <WG5620> that Barnabas <WG921> also <WG2532> was carried <WG4879> away <WG4879> with their dissimulation. <WG5272>

But when <WG3753> I saw <WG1492> that they walked <WG3716> not uprightly <WG3716> according <WG4314> to the truth <WG225> of the gospel, <WG2098> I said <WG2036> to Peter <WG4074> before <WG1715> them all, <WG3956> If <WG1487> you, being <WG5225> a Jew, <WG2453> live <WG2198> after the manner <WG1483> of Gentiles, <WG1483> and not as do the Jews, <WG2452> why <WG5101> compel <WG315> you the Gentiles <WG1484> to live <WG2198> as do the Jews? <WG2450>
We who are Jews <WG2453> by nature, <WG5449> and not sinners <WG268> of the Gentiles, <WG1484>

Knowing <WG1492> that a man <WG444> is not justified <WG1344> by the works <WG2041> of the law, <WG3551> but by the faith <WG4102> of Jesus <WG2424> Christ, <WG5547> even <WG2532> we have <WG2192> believed <WG4100> in Jesus <WG2424> Christ, <WG5547> that we might be justified <WG1344> by the faith <WG4102> of Christ, <WG5547> and not by the works <WG2041> of the law: <WG3551> for by the works <WG2041> of the law <WG3551> shall no <WG3756> <WG3956> flesh <WG4561> be justified. <WG1344>

But if, <WG1487> while we seek <WG2212> to be justified <WG1344> by Christ, <WG5547> we ourselves also <WG2532> are found <WG2147> sinners, <WG268> is therefore <WG686> Christ <WG5547> the minister <WG1249> of sin? <WG266> God <WG3361> <WG1096> forbid. <WG3361> <WG1096>
For if <WG1487> I build <WG3618> again <WG3825> the things which <WG3739> I destroyed, <WG2647> I make <WG4921> myself <WG1683> a transgressor. <WG3848>
For I through <WG1223> the law <WG3551> am dead <WG599> to the law, <WG3551> that I might live <WG2198> to God. <WG2316>

I am crucified <WG4957> with Christ: <WG5547> nevertheless <WG1161> I live; <WG2198> yet <WG3765> not I, but Christ <WG5547> lives <WG2198> in me: and the life which <WG3739> I now <WG3568> live <WG2198> in the flesh <WG4561> I live <WG2198> by the faith <WG4102> of the Son <WG5207> of God, <WG2316> who <WG3588> loved <WG25> me, and gave <WG3860> himself <WG1438> for me.
I do not frustrate <WG114> the grace <WG5485> of God: <WG2316> for if <WG1487> righteousness <WG1343> come by the law, <WG3551> then <WG686> Christ <WG5547> is dead <WG599> in vain. <WG1432>
